comment._content:
I have a letter here from my Mother, written to Dad while he was on a trip to the UK in May 1948.

I can remember the sounds and smells of the rowing boats as we rowed along here.
It is a favourite memory and association when I hear the water lapping at the clinker hulls of old boats.

Mother was holidaying here for a while, to rest from the effort of having three kids and no husband for a few months. Mum was writing the letter, sitting beside "a lovely large log fire alone."
